education.name: Duke University School of Medicine
highlights: Carrying out cutting-edge research on the neural mechanisms underlying skilled dexterous movements and kinematics.

education.name: University of Colorado Boulder
highlights: Thesis Title: Evaluating Stressor Controllability Effects in Female Rats

experience.name: Yin Laboratory, Duke University
highlights: Dissertation Title: Striatal Pathways for Action Counting and Steering

experience.name: Yin Laboratory, Duke University
highlights: Designed and programmed a novel operant task to measure decision making and kinematics.
Used kinematic and operant analysis of rodent behavior to understand task related movements.
Measured pathway activities using in-vivo calcium imaging to analyze their relationship to behavior.
Manipulated pathway activities with optogenetics to understand their functional contributions.
Developed a ‘push-pull’ model of how striatal pathways regulate movement trajectory.

experience.name: Maier & Greenwood Laboratories, University of Colorado Boulder & UC Denver
highlights: I researched the prophylactic effects of exercise on traumatic stress and the related neurobiological mechanisms.

experience.name: Maier Laboratory, University of Colorado Boulder
highlights: I researched the neural mechanisms underlying stress resilience. My work identified a key sex difference in stress outcomes and its neurobiological substrate.

experience.name: Todorovic Laboratory, Anschutz Medical Campus
highlights: My project explored the role of CaV3.2 channels in pain transmission and explored mechanisms of endogenous CaV3.2 channel modulation.
